result.execSummary:
The defendant Abel A. Sauceda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Abel A. Sauceda is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Abel A. Sauceda was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to 15CM1125.
Credit for 212 days if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
***Court costs, surcharge and restitution from file 15CM1125 are to be collected in this file.***

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Court costs, surcharge and restitution from file 15CM1126 are to be collected on this file.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not have contact with Michelle Veleta, her residence or her place of employment or her family, w/ exception of his child, AS, unless otherwise permitted by the court or the agent.  No association w/ any individuals who use or traffic in controlled substances.

timeConds.notes: As an ATR - Conditional time with credit since the 11-21-16 order to detain.  Huber allowed for employment and treatment.

AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION - ATR
***90-120 days conditional time or completion of the Living Free Program with credit since 8-23-17.  Huber allowed for employment and treatment. ***
***JOC is amended on 9-28-17 to read 120 days.  The Agent may request release upon successful completion of the Living Free Program.  ***
***As of probation review hrg on 4/26/18 - 120 days conditional jail time.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.

supervisions.notes:
PROBATION REVOKED  -  COMMENCE FORTHWITH
***
**JOC IS AMENDED TO CORRECT THE AMOUNT OF TIME SERVED ***

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  *  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges as previously ordered.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample unless previously provided & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   
May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Do not associate with any individuals who use or traffic in controlled substances.

supervisions.notes: **ANY UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE TO BE COLLECTED DURING EXTENDED SUPERVISION. ***

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions and is Consecutive to 15CM1125.  Credit for 212 days if revoked.  Pay costs & restitution in the amount of $79.45 as ordered and stipulated to by parties in 15CM1125.  Court costs & surcharge also ordered in this file.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm & Voting Acknowledgement given.  No contact with Michelle V., her residence, her place of employment or her family w/ the exception of his son, A.S. unless permitted by the court or agent.
from Defendant
Amended Motion and Brief in Support of Motion to Withdraw Guilty Plea filed by Atty Caspari.
Revised PSI request.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: PT
Arguments heard on DE's motion to withdraw plea.  Upon hearing arguments court grants motion to withdraw plea in 15CF830 and 15F950, but denies motion to withdraw plea in 15CF1027 & 15CM1125.  PSI request revised to only include the Branch 8 files.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Email received from probation agent Kenya Mason.  Defendant was advised by his attorney, Diane Caspari, to not conduct the PSI interview because he will be withdrawing his plea on all cases.  Therefore, a PSI will not be completed.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari who appears by phone.  Clerk: PT
Atty Caspari is ill today and appears by phone.  Atty Caspari states case will be resolved and requests a plea date.  DE is not waiving speedy trial demand at this time.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Oral speedy trial demand by defendant

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Diane Caspari.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Caspari recently appointed.  Per Atty Caspari, def. is not eligible for Drug Court.  Speedy trial demanded.  Status conf. 2/19/16 at 9:30.  Jury status heariing 3/24/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial 3/28/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
Diane Caspari  kmk

15CF1027 and 15CM1125 - Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Angela Komp (for Atty Carmen Lassiter).  Def. should know within a week if he is eligible for Drug Court.  Status conf. 1/27/16 at 9:00.  Bond continued.

15CF1027 & 15CM1125 - Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. may be eligible for Drug Court; to undergo their assessment process.  Status conf. 1/6/16 at 9:20.  Bond continued.

15CF1027 & 15CM1125 - Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk K. Zirbel.
